conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D. Predict which container (E or F) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
A, B, C, and D are the initial points where liquid flows out.
Yellow, green, blue, and gray baffles are positioned below A, B, C, and D respectively.
Container E is orange and positioned to the left, while container F is green and positioned to the right.
Liquid flows downward from A and encounters the yellow baffle.
Liquid flows to the left along the yellow baffle and continues downward.
Liquid from A reaches container E.
Liquid flows downward from B and encounters the green baffle.
Liquid flows to the left along the green baffle and continues downward.
Liquid from B reaches container E.
Liquid flows downward from C and encounters the blue baffle.
Liquid flows to the left along the blue baffle and continues downward.
Liquid from C reaches container E.
Liquid flows downward from D and encounters the gray baffle.
Liquid flows to the left along the gray baffle and continues downward.
Liquid from D reaches container E.
All liquids from points A, B, C, and D flow into container E.
The liquid will flow into container E after passing through the baffles.
